Package com.linecorp.armeria.server

Interface PathMapping

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPathMapping
    public interface PathMapping
    Matches the absolute path part of a URI and extracts path parameters from it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      PathMappingResult apply​(PathMappingContext mappingCtx)
      Matches the specified path and extracts the path parameters from it.
      default int complexity()
      Returns the complexity of this path mapping.
      Optional<String> exactPath()
      Returns the exact path of this path mapping if it is an exact path mapping, or Optional.empty() otherwise.
      String loggerName()
      Returns the logger name.
      String meterTag()
      Returns the value of the "pathMapping" Tag in a Meter.
      static PathMapping of​(String pathPattern)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches the specified pathPattern. e.g.
      static PathMapping ofCatchAll()
      Returns a singleton PathMapping that always matches any path.
      static PathMapping ofExact​(String exactPath)
      Creates a new PathMapping that performs an exact match.
      static PathMapping ofGlob​(String glob)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified glob expression, where "*" matches a path component non-recursively and "**" matches path components recursively.
      static PathMapping ofPrefix​(String pathPrefix)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix.
      static PathMapping ofPrefix​(String pathPrefix, boolean stripPrefix)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix.
      static PathMapping ofRegex​(String regex)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression and extracts the values of the named groups.
      static PathMapping ofRegex​(Pattern regex)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression and extracts the values of the named groups.
      Set<String> paramNames()
      Returns the names of the path parameters extracted by this mapping.
      Optional<String> prefix()
      Returns the prefix of this path mapping if it is a prefix mapping, or Optional.empty() otherwise.
      default Optional<String> triePath()
      Returns the path of this path mapping if it is able to be added to a trie.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static PathMapping of​(String pathPattern)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches the specified pathPattern. e.g.
        • /login (no path parameters)
        • /users/{userId} (curly-brace style)
        • /list/:productType/by/:ordering (colon style)
        • exact:/foo/bar (exact match)
        • prefix:/files (prefix match)
        • glob:/~*/downloads/** (glob pattern)
        • regex:^/files/(?<filePath>.*)$ (regular expression)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified path pattern is invalid

      • ofRegex

        static PathMapping ofRegex​(Pattern regex)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression and extracts the values of the named groups. e.g. "^/users/(?<userId>[0-9]+)$" will extract the second numeric part of the path into the "userId" path parameter.

      • ofRegex

        static PathMapping ofRegex​(String regex)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression and extracts the values of the named groups. e.g. "^/users/(?<userId>[0-9]+)$" will extract the second numeric part of the path into the "userId" path parameter.

      • ofGlob

        static PathMapping ofGlob​(String glob)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified glob expression, where "*" matches a path component non-recursively and "**" matches path components recursively.

      • ofPrefix

        static PathMapping ofPrefix​(String pathPrefix)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix. It also removes the specified directory prefix from the matched path so that RequestContext.path() does not have the specified directory prefix. For example, when pathPrefix is "/foo/":
        • "/foo/" translates to "/"
        • "/foo/bar" translates to "/bar"
        • "/foo/bar/baz" translates to "/bar/baz"
        This method is a shortcut to ofPrefix(pathPrefix, true).

      • ofPrefix

        static PathMapping ofPrefix​(String pathPrefix,
                            boolean stripPrefix)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix. When stripPrefix is true, it also removes the specified directory prefix from the matched path so that RequestContext.path() does not have the specified directory prefix. For example, when pathPrefix is "/foo/":
        • "/foo/" translates to "/"
        • "/foo/bar" translates to "/bar"
        • "/foo/bar/baz" translates to "/bar/baz"

      • ofExact

        static PathMapping ofExact​(String exactPath)
        Creates a new PathMapping that performs an exact match.

      • ofCatchAll

        static PathMapping ofCatchAll()
        Returns a singleton PathMapping that always matches any path.

      • apply

        PathMappingResult apply​(PathMappingContext mappingCtx)
        Matches the specified path and extracts the path parameters from it.
        Parameters:
        mappingCtx - a context to find the Service.
        Returns:
        a non-empty PathMappingResult if the specified path matches this mapping. PathMappingResult.empty() if not matches.

      • paramNames

        Set<String> paramNames()
        Returns the names of the path parameters extracted by this mapping.

      • loggerName

        String loggerName()
        Returns the logger name.
        Returns:
        the logger name whose components are separated by a dot (.)

      • meterTag

        String meterTag()
        Returns the value of the "pathMapping" Tag in a Meter.

      • exactPath

        Optional<String> exactPath()
        Returns the exact path of this path mapping if it is an exact path mapping, or Optional.empty() otherwise. This can be useful for services which provide logic after scanning the server's mapped services, e.g. DocService

      • prefix

        Optional<String> prefix()
        Returns the prefix of this path mapping if it is a prefix mapping, or Optional.empty() otherwise. This can be useful for services which provide logic after scanning the server's mapped services, e.g. DocService
        Returns:
        the prefix that ends with '/' if this mapping is a prefix mapping

      • triePath

        default Optional<String> triePath()
        Returns the path of this path mapping if it is able to be added to a trie.

      • complexity

        default int complexity()
        Returns the complexity of this path mapping. It would be increased if this path mapping has more conditions to check.
